data.text: What’s new? They are smaller and they have new security features such as the “satellite hologram” – when you tilt the banknote you see tiny € symbols moving around the number! Get to know their new design and features in 3D here https://t.co/4vQJK7BH2p https://t.co/qndTCH1G9z

#NewBanknotes are in circulation as of today! With a new design and innovative security features, the new €100 and €200 notes are even more durable and make counterfeiting all the more difficult. They complete the “Europa series”, the second series of euro banknotes. https://t.co/9FS0L3YNdw
Working paper: The architecture of supervision https://t.co/MqYftCSofl
TARGET Annual Report 2018 https://t.co/6nH6kF6cBe
Speech Benoît Cœuré: Payments for the people https://t.co/9y1chH8p3N

What has the euro meant for the lives of Europeans? What are the future challenges for the euro? The YouTubers from @VisualPolitik asked these questions to our experts and produced a documentary about the history of the euro and the ECB. Check it out! https://t.co/DhQbsvncdi
Working paper: Bank capital in the short and in the long run https://t.co/LxjHaDT6O1
Want to know more about how banknotes are made? Watch our video documentary about the production of banknotes https://t.co/hnJWZyvGxl #NewBanknotes https://t.co/6LlzlPVjy7

So, what’s new about the €100 and €200 banknotes entering into circulation on 28 May? Ton Roos, Director of Banknotes at the ECB, shows us their new security features. #NewBanknotes https://t.co/XfS9tbx70F

After the serial number has been printed on the back of the notes and the sheets have been thoroughly inspected for misprints, it’s onto the final stage of the printing process: the cutting machine! The machine slices piles of sheets into strips and then into stacks of banknotes. https://t.co/XHPb2LMI4p

During the “intaglio printing” ink is applied to the paper under high pressure, giving the images texture and creating the raised lines that you can feel on the left and right edges of the banknotes. https://t.co/L5AhMQc67c

First we meet the “offset machine”. It prints a multi-coloured background on both sides of the paper, which has already been cut into sheets and had the watermark, portrait hologram and security thread embedded. https://t.co/l0M2G84Qmy

Ever wondered how banknotes are made? Follow us behind the scenes at a printing works in Rome to see how the new €200 notes are produced! We’ve updated the €100 and €200 notes with a new design and security features. They are entering into circulation next week. #NewBanknotes https://t.co/6XWz6x9ICo
Speech Luis de Guindos: Building the EU’s capital markets - What remains to be done https://t.co/dYEDyk2Fbe
Working paper: Cross-border effects of prudential regulation - Evidence from the euro area https://t.co/OC29sbR8B8

#ClimateChange affects everyone, including central banks. We at the ECB are well aware of this fact and we are contributing – within our mandate – to tackling this global challenge. Find out exactly how here https://t.co/REQeA4riJR https://t.co/K9WWNrMkh8
Research bulletin: Prudential regulation, national differences and banking stability https://t.co/3dHhiOnm53

We all rely on banks and need them to be safe and sound. To keep going in bad times, banks have to hold enough capital. But what is capital and how does it make banks more resilient? And how much capital do eurozone banks need to hold? Read our explainer https://t.co/WDIrQ3SiFs https://t.co/bwWMKBgrPi
Watch President Draghi speak about Peter Praet’s contribution to the ECB or click here for the full recording of the event https://t.co/ZTGMDxCJoc https://t.co/TCXnFA0YXa

“My contract is very simple – price stability (…) and I am convinced that the strategy that we have followed works”, said Executive Board member and Chief Economist Peter Praet today at an ECB event organised in his honour. His term at the ECB ends later this month. https://t.co/klloBV5HlO

@howardjp Yes, exceptionally EU citizenship is not a criterion for this particular vacancy.
Our pre-selection committee will draw a gender-diverse shortlist of suitable candidates. Apply by 12 June 2019 https://t.co/xxvm7KCEDN

Want to shape the future of European banking supervision? We are looking for candidates of recognised standing and experience in banking and financial matters, who could take on the role of ECB representative to the Supervisory Board. Read more https://t.co/JfkCPNcCBv https://t.co/XLBSPSxj2s

Today we celebrate the International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia and Biphobia. We want the ECB to be a place where all can thrive and be themselves, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, or other aspects of their identity

New euro banknotes are as durable as ever. On 28 May, the new €100 and €200 notes will enter into circulation, bringing the current ‘Europa’ series to a close. You can see what they will look like here https://t.co/uPwibuMOsL #NewBanknotes

Ever accidentally put money through the wash? If it’s a euro note, you don’t need to worry – they are designed to withstand extreme conditions, such as submersion and heat. Watch our video to learn more https://t.co/GSaNLvz63C https://t.co/JdDk9xqCU4
Speech Benoît Cœuré: The rise of services and the transmission of monetary policy https://t.co/7FvrPuIkZv Slides https://t.co/eR5bttCalH

Are you a researcher or student interested in fields, such as instant payments, #fintech and crypto-assets? We’re looking for papers for a joint ECB – National Bank of Belgium conference on 26-27 November in Brussels. @NBB_BNB_NL @NBB_BNB_FR Find out more https://t.co/c88s5YZthP https://t.co/XvjOZScuao

ECB Banking Supervision sees climate change as one of the risk drivers affecting euro area banks in coming years. At the same time, the transition to a greener economy offers opportunities for banks. How do supervisors approach this complex topic? https://t.co/JeEwkhU3eg 3/3 https://t.co/Zf208LtQS1

Many central banks and supervisors have acknowledged the need to address #climatechange and related financial risks. The ECB is part of a group called the Network for Greening the Financial System. Frank Elderson explains what #NGFS has been up to https://t.co/LjNx0Roch4 2/3 https://t.co/7EP6AnfdTl

(THREAD) How does #climatechange affect banks? It translates into financial risk via two channels: what we call physical risk and transition risk. Frank Elderson, Executive Director of the Dutch central bank @DNB_NL, explains https://t.co/wO3tlaSv8C 1/3 https://t.co/UwnDB3RvFl

What is the role of banking supervisors in the context of #ClimateChange? #Brexit: what’s the state of play? What do non-executive directors on banks’ boards and lighthouses have in common? To find out, read our Supervision Newsletter https://t.co/KN4fiOJvWD https://t.co/eH6QoyaPcK

€STR, the new euro short-term rate, will replace EONIA later this year. What will happen to new and legacy contracts referencing EONIA? Read the recommendations made by the working group on euro risk-free rates and share your comments by 12 June https://t.co/KoQxJySmzs https://t.co/azJTIU57xy

One week left to submit your paper, or its abstract, for our upcoming conference on gender and career progression organised together with @bankofengland and @federalreserve. We welcome papers on a variety of topics – see our website for more information https://t.co/7kbrQ9zuDG https://t.co/oquAIl6zwU

The #GenerationEuro Students’ Award ceremony takes place today at the ECB. The winning teams will get to put their questions to Mario Draghi. Tune in to our webcast at 13:30 to watch! https://t.co/UL7IVxZOLl

Today and tomorrow the winners of the #GenerationEuro Students’ Award visit the ECB. Tomorrow they will get the chance to put questions to ECB President Mario Draghi. Watch live from 13:30 CET on Twitter #ECBYouthDialogue https://t.co/1HnkBUzkKh

And that’s a wrap! Thank you so much to everyone involved in the conference on an innovative single market for the euro. Special thanks to @lydia_hallie for her live coverage from the hackathon. https://t.co/cFX47tcVH5

Follow @TARGET_ECB for direct updates on the conference, where – in addition to talks on topics such as cyber resilience and the future of card payments – independent payment service providers will showcase their best new payment tech solutions 4/4
Software developer @lydia_hallie will be at the ECB, reporting live as the hackathon progresses. Follow her for updates, interviews and more 3/4

Making the most of increasingly sophisticated technology requires increasingly creative solutions. Our conference on an innovative single market for the euro features a two-day coding project – or hackathon – that aims to find new solutions for online and mobile payments 2/4

The quote comes from a speech Mario Draghi, President of the ECB, gave back in 2012 when the eurozone was in a debt crisis. It helped to reassure everyone – especially financial markets – of our commitment to the euro. You can read the full speech here https://t.co/H5sYLVGWmd

It’s our job to keep prices stable in the eurozone, so that you can rely on the euros in your pocket being worth more or less the same tomorrow as they are today. And we are fully committed to this task https://t.co/mLJLhPR0oC
The #Avengers aren’t the only ones who promised to do #WhateverItTakes!  Almost 7 years ago, we heard something similar… https://t.co/j1rS2Ke4vo
